What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Feature Request

Related Page / Object:
Invoice and Contracts

Feature Description:
We need there to be a directly link between invoice line items and contracts that are created in the system associated with those line items.  This is required to accurately report financially the start and end date for contracts for revenue recognition purposes.

Business Priority & Sprint Target:
High priority to close the books

User Story:
As a finance user, I need to be able to directly connect the invoice line items to the contract that was created from it so I can understand start dates, end dates, and other details from contract that may be necessary.

Acceptance Criteria:
Ability to create invoice line item report that also includes the contract start and end date in it at the line item level if there is a contract associated with it.

Contract and Invoice line item connection

Additional Context:
Talk to Josh

data.name: [SFDC-2281] Call logging & notifications failing
data.notes:
Name:
Leslie Onley

Email Address:
leslie.onley@safetyservicescompany.com

Department Represented:
CUST - Client Success

Manager Approval:
Yes

Issue Description (5 words or less):
[Bug | SFDC RingCentral] Call logging & notifications failing – Compliance risk

Explanation of Needs:
This master ticket consolidates multiple related tickets regarding the Salesforce–RingCentral integration. The issues include:

    Completed calls remaining on the call report after completion
    Call notification pop-ups not appearing for inbound or outbound calls
    Call recordings not being captured in Salesforce
    Some incoming/outgoing calls not appearing in Salesforce

These problems lead to inaccurate call lists, missed follow-ups, and pose a risk of non-compliance with regulations such as the FDCPA. We need to investigate the root cause of the integration problems and implement a fix to ensure:

    Accurate call logging
    Timely notifications
    Call recording capture

Once resolved, we will roll it out across the Client Success team. The underlying tickets are SFDC-2260, SFDC-2258, SFDC-615, and SFDC-542 (links provided in the additional information section).

Definition of Done:  

    Completed calls are automatically removed from call lists and reports once logged in Salesforce.
    RingCentral call notification pop-ups appear reliably in Salesforce for inbound and outbound calls.
    Call recordings are captured and attached to the call record in Salesforce.
    All incoming and outgoing calls are logged to the contact/account record and call report.
    These behaviors are verified by multiple Client Success users before closing the ticket.

How Can We Help You Today?
Salesforce

Type of Salesforce Request:
SFDC - Bug

Steps to Reproduce:

    Log in to Salesforce and open the RingCentral soft phone.
    Place an outbound call to a customer or receive an inbound call.
    Complete the call and allow RingCentral to log the call activity.
    Check the call notification pop-up – no pop-up appears in Salesforce for some calls.
    Navigate to the call list report or the contact/account activity history; the call may not appear at all, or the completed call still appears on the call list.
    Attempt to access the call recording from the call record; the recording link is absent.

These steps reproduce the various symptoms across multiple users.

Expected vs Actual Behavior:

    Expected: 
        Completed calls should drop off the call list once logged.
        Call notifications should pop up for inbound/outbound calls.
        Call recordings should capture and attach to call records.
        All incoming and outgoing calls should log to Salesforce.
    Actual: 
        Completed calls remain on the call list.
        Call notifications are sporadic or absent.
        Call recordings are missing.
        Some calls do not log at all.

Severity Rating:
High severity – this bug affects daily call workflows for the Client Success team and leads to missed follow-ups and compliance risk. A timely fix or hotfix is needed.

User Story:
As a Client Success agent, I want all calls and recordings to log properly in Salesforce with real-time notifications so that I can focus on contacting customers, avoid duplicate calls, and meet compliance requirements.

Acceptance Criteria:

    When a call is completed and logged by RingCentral, it no longer appears on the call list or call report.
    For inbound and outbound calls, a RingCentral notification pop-up appears in Salesforce with caller info and actions.
    Each call has an associated recording accessible from the call record in Salesforce.
    All calls (inbound/outbound) are logged under the account/contact activity history and appear on call reports. Verified across multiple Client Success users.

ESCAPE Philosophy Element:
C - Centralize

Business/Client Importance:
Accurate and timely call logging and notifications are essential for maintaining compliance with the FDCPA and other regulations, ensuring that we do not repeatedly contact customers or miss follow-ups. The Client Success team relies on call data in Salesforce to prioritize outreach, track performance, and avoid compliance issues. Without a fix, we risk lost revenue, reduced productivity, and poor customer experience.

Importance to Daily Work:
High

Most Impacted Group:
Entire Department or Team

Customer/Staff Impact:
10-49

Additional Context:
This ticket consolidates multiple open tickets (SFDC-2260, SFDC-2258, SFDC-615, SFDC-542) concerning the same underlying issue. Please review those tasks for detailed notes, user comments, and example cases. The issue manifests across multiple users, call types, and devices, and may be intermittent.

Subtasks:

    https://app.asana.com/1/169426931772429/project/1210016542964783/task/1211143822680700?focus=true 
    https://app.asana.com/1/169426931772429/project/1210016542964783/task/1211142177152353?focus=true 
    https://app.asana.com/1/169426931772429/project/1210016542964783/task/1210812053263100?focus=true 
    https://app.asana.com/1/169426931772429/project/1210015162248599/task/1210515657371049?focus=true 
    https://app.asana.com/1/169426931772429/project/1210016542964783/task/1210501957406645?focus=true

data.name: [SFDC-2272] Add ACH Payment Confirmation Screen in Portal
data.notes:
Summary
The Finance team requests a redirect to a confirmation screen after successful ACH payment submissions in the customer portal. Currently, users remain on a spinner with no confirmation, causing confusion. The confirmation screen must clearly state that a microdeposit will be initiated to the user’s bank account.

Value or Impact

    Improves customer experience at a critical payment step, reducing confusion and support contacts.
    Supports revenue by clarifying completion and next steps, decreasing perceived failures/drop-off.
    Aligns with Experience-First and Simplify principles.
    Affects External Customers (500+) in the Salesforce portal payment flow.

Acceptance Criteria

    After a successful ACH payment, the user is automatically redirected from the spinner state to a confirmation screen.
    The confirmation screen explicitly communicates that a microdeposit will be initiated to the user’s bank account.
    Redirect occurs reliably for successful ACH submissions in the portal flow.
    No regression to the prior “spinner-only” end state.

Technical Details

    Implement a post-ACH-submission redirect from the portal’s ACH flow to a confirmation screen.
    Display messaging stating that a microdeposit will be initiated.
    Ensure behavior applies to the “ACH Payments in Portal” context.
    Include basic QA validation for the success path in a non-production environment before deployment.

Affected Systems

    ACH Payments in Portal (customer-facing payment flow)
    Salesforce (portal context)

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Confirm the exact portal component/entry point that should trigger the redirect.
    Confirm final confirmation copy and any localization needs.
    Coordinate basic QA in a non-production environment for the success path prior to deployment.
    Point of contact: https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209983858600782.
    Related resources: Intake form: https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429
    Related Request IDs: SFDC-2272; FIN-337; TIE-2329

data.name: [SFDC-2268] Automate invoice due date on Opportunity
data.notes:
Summary
This request seeks to automate the calculation of payment due dates for Prequal Auto-Renewals in Salesforce Opportunities. The automation would add a "New Contract Start Date" field and automatically calculate a "Payment Due Date" as 15 calendar days before the contract start date, eliminating manual calculations currently performed by CSMs and reducing errors in the invoicing process.

Value or Impact
This automation will significantly improve the client payment experience and reduce processing errors for Finance. Currently, CSMs must manually calculate and enter payment due dates in Special Invoicing Instructions Notes, which is error-prone and time-consuming. The change affects over 500 customers and is expected to have a direct impact on reducing cancellations by ensuring timely and accurate invoice generation.

Acceptance Criteria

    Two new fields created on Salesforce Opportunity object:        "New Contract Start Date" field (label negotiable)
        "Payment Due Date" field that auto-populates

    Payment Due Date automatically calculates as 15 calendar days before New Contract Start Date
    Calculation uses true calendar days (not business days)
    Fields are accessible to CSMs during Opportunity creation
    Finance can view and utilize the auto-generated Payment Due Date for invoice processing

Technical Details

    Object: Salesforce Opportunity
    Field Type: Date fields with formula/automation
    Calculation Logic: Payment Due Date = New Contract Start Date - 15 days
    Potential Conflict: https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209127958101691 and https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209983858600782 identified possible logic conflicts with existing field automation
    Fallback Solution: If direct field automation conflicts arise, output calculated date to Special Invoicing Instructions for Finance verification

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Objects: Opportunity (primary)
    Departments: Client Success (CUST), Finance (FIN)
    Process Impact: Prequal Auto-Renewal workflow
    Integration Points: Invoice generation system, payment processing

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Verify no conflicts with existing Opportunity field logic and automation
    Confirm with Finance team that 15-day calculation meets all use cases
    Consider fallback approach of outputting to Special Invoicing Instructions if direct field automation proves problematic
    Target delivery within 7-10 business days as requested due to potential impact on cancellations
    Follow up with https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210642879338961 regarding priority status (last checked Oct 7)

----------------------------------------

Original Description (Retained)

Name:
Jessica Messersmith

Email address:
jessica.messersmith@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
CUST - Client Success

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
External Customers

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
500+

How important is this to your daily work?:
High

Select any department that is also impacted.:
CUST - Client Success
FIN - Finance

Has your manager approved this ticket?:
Yes

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Feature Request

Related Page / Object:
On the "Opportunity" page 

Feature Description:
Currently, for Prequal Renewals, payment for invoices is due upon receipt of opportunity. As part of the process-change to Prequal Auto-Renewals and to improve the client payment experience, we will be changing the payment due date to 15 days prior to new contract start date. With the existing functionality in the Salesforce Opportunity, the CSM would need to update the Special Invoicing Instructions Notes with the new payment due date. 

This process is highly manual, requires mental math, creates margin for error, and is not sustainable. I would like to add an entry for the new contract date that then automatically generates the payment due date (15 true days prior to new contract date) for Finance. 

Business Priority & Sprint Target:
High-priority, within the next 7-10 business days - given the assumptions that this will have a direct impact on Cancellations. Within the next Sprint cycle please. 

User Story:
As a CSM, I want to be able to enter a new contract start date when generating a Prequal Renewal Opportunity in Salesforce. I want that start date to then automatically populate a payment due date (of 15 days prior to that date) for Finance to generate and send the invoice. 

Acceptance Criteria:
Two new fields exist on a Salesforce Opportunity: 

    a New Contract Start Date (field verbiage negotiable) 
    a Payment Due Date that auto-generates for 15 days prior to the New Contract Start Date

What should we call this?:
Updating Invoice Due Date 

———————————————

data.name: [SFDC-2299] Remove contact from DNC list
data.notes:
SFDC Description Enrichment Summary

1. Summary
Client Success is unable to contact an existing client (Lonnie Schultz, CID 212710) due to a Do Not Call block in the Salesforce/RingCentral system. The request is to remove this block to restore outbound calling capability for revenue-related client outreach, following proper compliance verification.

2. Value or Impact
This directly impacts Client Success's ability to maintain client relationships and protect revenue streams. The block affects multiple team members (2-9 people per intake) who need to contact this specific client for business-critical communications. Resolution will restore productivity and prevent potential client churn due to lack of communication.

3. Acceptance Criteria
• CSR can successfully initiate outbound calls to (812) 881-9217 from Salesforce without receiving DNC/block errors
• Only the specific DNC flag for this contact/phone number is cleared per company policy
• Audit trail added to the record showing requester (Kevin Martillo), date, reason, and CID 212710
• If legal/compliance restrictions exist, document findings without removing block and report rationale to requester
• Call successfully connects when initiated from the Salesforce contact page

4. Technical Details
The system involves Salesforce Contact/Lead objects with DoNotCall fields and RingCentral CTI integration. Key data points include CID 212710, Contact name Lonnie Schultz, and phone (812) 881-9217. The error appears as a popup dialog stating "This contact is on a Do Not Call list" when attempting to dial. Investigation needed to determine if block originates from Salesforce fields, RingCentral settings, or true legal DNC compliance.

5. Affected Systems
• Salesforce Contact and Lead objects (DoNotCall and opt-out fields)
• RingCentral CTI/softphone integration within Salesforce
• Salesforce activity logging and call history
• Communication preference and compliance settings
• Potential interaction with national DNC registry if applicable

6. Next Steps or Analyst Notes
Daniel DeZago noted that true legal DNC removal may not be permissible if this is a personal/cell number on the official registry. Initial investigation shows no explicit "DNC" setting in Salesforce, suggesting this may be a RingCentral configuration issue. Recommended approach: verify Contact.DoNotCall field status, check RingCentral block lists, confirm business relationship exists for compliance, and test call functionality after any adjustments. Currently assigned to Kiran Kumar for resolution.

7. Original Description Reference
The complete original description with full technical specifications is retained in the task Description field above. Key excerpt: "Attempting to call client Lonnie Schultz at (812) 881-9217; system reports the client is on a DNC list. CID: 212710."

Title Status: Title already compliant with standard format: [SFDC-2299] Remove contact from DNC list

Lift-Based Timeline Review: Current Lift is "90 min - Small" which typically aligns with a 2-day due date. The task is currently due Oct 24 2025 (approximately 1 day from now based on Oct 23 context), which is slightly aggressive but reasonable given the revenue impact and client communication urgency.

Technical Content Preservation: All technical details from the original description have been preserved. The structured format enhances clarity while maintaining the complete technical context needed for implementation.

Handoff Note: Ready for R4 – Prioritization+.

data.name: [SFDC-2303] Enhance Lead Source Attribution for PPC
data.notes:
Summary
Marketing requests cleanup and enhancement of Lead Source attribution in Salesforce to eliminate “unknown” sources for inbound leads, especially PPC. This will improve the accuracy of campaign attribution and PPC reporting. Leadership-approved updates to the lead source taxonomy are documented in the provided Lucidchart.

Value or Impact
Accurate lead source attribution enables reliable marketing ROI reporting, improved budget allocation, and clear leadership visibility into channel performance. This affects the Marketing team’s ability to measure and optimize PPC and other channels tied to revenue outcomes.

Acceptance Criteria

    New inbound leads are created with a non-unknown Lead Source.
    Campaign attribution is added/enhanced for PPC-related leads.
    Lead Source picklist includes the values provided by Marketing, including “GCS Gold New.”
    Historical behavior: “unknown” does not appear for newly created leads after deployment (existing historical records may be handled separately if requested).
    Spot-check validation: Create at least one test lead per key inbound path (e.g., PPC and web form) and confirm Lead Source populates correctly.

Technical Details

    Update the Lead Source picklist to include the Marketing-provided values (see list below), including “GCS Gold New.”
    Implement or refine attribution logic so inbound leads, specifically PPC, populate Lead Source accurately.
    Ensure the logic to set Lead Source runs consistently for all inbound entry points where this field is expected to populate.
    No changes to scope beyond picklist updates and attribution logic refinement are specified.
    Reference: Leadership-approved source mapping and path are documented here: https://lucid.app/lucidchart/a24ab6eb-ebb5-4e0d-862b-5d66886d9088/edit?page=0_0&invitationId=inv_2dce7ae2-1d03-426c-b24a-096c1f1a43b0#.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Lead object (Lead Source field), Campaign attribution for PPC-related leads.

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Finalize picklist: Use the leadership-approved list in the Lucidchart; confirm if any remaining dependency on https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209998459158916 exists or if approval supersedes prior dependency.
    Implement picklist changes in Salesforce and deploy.
    Adjust attribution logic for PPC and ensure coverage across all inbound entry points.
    Execute spot-check tests for PPC and web form paths and verify Lead Source is never “unknown.”
    Dependency note (historical): Earlier dependency on Derrick’s review; latest update indicates leadership approval and changes reflected in Lucidchart.

Original Description

Marketing requests cleanup and enhancement of Lead Source attribution in Salesforce. Many leads are currently entering as “unknown,” preventing accurate campaign- and PPC-related reporting.

data.name: [SFDC-2265] Create Invoice Payment Timing Report
data.notes:
Summary
Request to create a Salesforce report that combines Invoice details with Payment details, enabling analysis of invoice date and payment date together. Primary objective is to measure collections within X days of invoice issuance (e.g., within 2 days).

Value or Impact

    Audience: FIN - Finance & Strategy
    Goal: Quantify how much is collected within a defined window (e.g., 2 days) after invoicing to inform cash flow and operational performance.
    Impact: Entire department or team (approx. 10–49 impacted). Improves finance visibility and decision-making.

Acceptance Criteria

    A report (or report type + report) that includes both Invoice and Payment records in a single view.
    Fields available in the report:        Invoice Date (from Invoice)
        Payment Date (from Payment)
        Invoice identifier and related Account/Customer
        Payment Amount and Invoice Amount

    Ability to filter or group by:        Payment Date
        Invoice Date
        Days Between Invoice and Payment (calculated or equivalent filterable criteria)

    Ability to segment payments “within N days” of invoice issuance (e.g., 0–2 days), and to summarize totals/percentages paid within that window.
    Report can be saved and run by Finance users with existing permissions.

Technical Details

    Likely requires a Custom Report Type (invoices with related payments) so that both Invoice and Payment fields are accessible in one report.
    A formula field or row-level formula may be used to compute Days to Pay = Payment Date − Invoice Date, enabling filters such as ≤ 2.
    Consider handling one-to-many relationships (multiple payments per invoice). Decide on row-level granularity (one row per payment vs. per invoice).
    Validate field/API names for:        Invoice: Invoice Date, Invoice Amount, Invoice Number/ID, Account
        Payment: Payment Date, Payment Amount, related Invoice

    Ensure Finance has report folder access and object/field-level permissions to run the report.
    Report type: “Invoices with Payments” (name TBD based on org object model).

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Reports & Dashboards
    Salesforce Objects: Invoice, Payment (exact object/API names to be confirmed)
    Permissions: Finance reporting access to both objects and fields

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Confirm object model and exact field/API names for Invoice and Payment.
    Confirm whether multiple payments per invoice should be counted in totals and how to handle partial payments.
    Define the “window” parameter (e.g., 2 days) and whether additional windows are needed (e.g., 0–2, 3–7, 8–30).
    Build/enable custom report type if not already available, then create a summary/matrix report with filters and formula for Days to Pay.
    Validate results with sample data and confirm totals with Finance.
    No blockers identified in the request; access/permissions and object relationships are key dependencies.

Original Description
————————
Name:
Josh Metzger

Email address:
josh.metzger@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
FIN - Finance & Strategy

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
Entire Department or Team

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
10-49

How important is this to your daily work?:
Medium

Select any department that is also impacted.:
TIE - IT & Engineering

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Feature Request

Related Page / Object:
Invoice + Payment Details

Feature Description:
I need a report in which I can see both invoice details and payment details in one report.  Ultimately, I am looking to report on a combination of the invoice date and payment date.  Currently, I cannot get the payment date included in any of the invoice reports.

Business Priority & Sprint Target:
The owners like to see how much of our invoices get paid within 2 days of invoicing.  Without this feature, we cannot do this.  So high priority. 

User Story:
As a finance user and business owner, I want to see how much we are collecting upfront (within 2 days of invoice). 

Acceptance Criteria:
Ability to create a report that has details on both invoice and payments. 

What should we call this?:
Invoice + Payment details report

Additional Context:
N/A

data.name: [SFDC-2306] Fix Product Duration Error for Opportunity
data.notes:
Name:
Sarah Hildestad

Email address:
sarah.hildestad@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
SALE - Sales

Has your manager approved this ticket?:
Yes

Describe this issue in five words or less. This is used as guidance for the title.:
Opportunity product duration error

Use this space to explain what you need.:
When attempting to update Opportunity 006Ub00000Q8y9lIAB in Salesforce, the system returns an error indicating that one of the opportunity products lacks a valid duration. The product causing the issue has the ID 00kUb00000EPn0kIAD and is named "Safety Meetings: All Meetings At Once (Email CON AAO) Renewal English 52." 

The error message reads:

Opportunity_BeforeUpdate: execution of BeforeUpdate caused by:
OppAssignmentHandler.OpportunityException: Product on the opportunity: 00kUb00000EPn0kIAD: Safety Meetings: All Meetings At Once (Email CON AAO) Renewal English 52 has no valid duration for the contract. Please fill up the product duration field
Class.OppAssignmentHandler.createItemContractFromRule: line 541, column 1
Class.OppAssignmentHandler.process: line 95, column 1
Class.OpportunityTriggerHandler.beforeUpdate: line 31, column 1
Trigger.Opportunity_BeforeUpdate: line 28, column 1

This prevents the opportunity from being saved. We need assistance resolving this so the update will save successfully.

This is what DONE looks like:
The Opportunity (ID 006Ub00000Q8y9lIAB) can be saved/updated successfully without encountering the product duration error. The offending product has a valid duration defined, and the save completes without triggering the "Opportunity_BeforeUpdate" error message.

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Bug

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Salesforce and navigate to Opportunity 006Ub00000Q8y9lIAB.
2. Attempt to edit/update the opportunity and click Save.
3. Observe that the save fails and the system displays the error regarding a missing product duration for product 00kUb00000EPn0kIAD (Safety Meetings: All Meetings At Once (Email CON AAO) Renewal English 52).

Expected vs Actual Behavior:
Expected: The opportunity saves successfully after editing. Actual: The save fails and shows an error stating that the product "Safety Meetings: All Meetings At Once (Email CON AAO) Renewal English 52" has no valid duration for the contract.

Rate the Severity:
High. This bug blocks the ability to update and close an opportunity, delaying contract renewals and revenue.

User Story:
As a sales or operations user, I want to edit and save an opportunity without encountering a product duration error, so that I can process renewals and maintain accurate opportunity data.

Acceptance Criteria:
- The system allows the opportunity to be saved after editing without raising an error about product duration.
- The product duration field is validated and populated appropriately for product ID 00kUb00000EPn0kIAD.
- No Opportunity_BeforeUpdate exceptions occur when saving the opportunity.

Select which element of our ESCAPE philosophy best fits with this ticket.:
E - Experience

Why does this matter to the business or client?:
This issue blocks sales and operations from updating and closing a renewal opportunity. If the opportunity cannot be saved, contract renewals are delayed, revenue is impacted, and our records remain inaccurate. Ensuring product durations are correctly set is critical for compliance and a smooth customer experience.

How important is this to your daily work?:
High

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
Multiple People

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
2-9

Additional Context:
Opportunity ID: 006Ub00000Q8y9lIAB
Product ID: 00kUb00000EPn0kIAD (Safety Meetings: All Meetings At Once (Email CON AAO) Renewal English 52)
A screenshot of the error message is attached. Please advise on correct product duration or steps to resolve.

———————————————

data.notes:
Name:
Amanda Apodaca

Email address:
amanda.apodaca@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
SALE - Sales

Has your manager approved this ticket?:
Yes

Describe this issue in five words or less. This is used as guidance for the title.:
Calls will not disconnect and RC is down

Use this space to explain what you need.:
Ring central will not disconnect/ Ring Central down due to multiple tabs open

This is what DONE looks like:
Ring central will not disconnect/ Ring Central down due to multiple tabs open

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Admin Support

How important is this to your daily work?:
Critical

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
Just Me

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
Just Me

———————————————
This task was submitted through Technology Solutions Ticketing
https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

—

TIE Supplemental Intake — Incident (Degraded Service)
• Observed Behavior: RingCentral would not disconnect calls; user perceived RingCentral as “down” while ~many Salesforce tabs were open.
• Frequency/Scope: Single user (Amanda Apodaca, Sales).
• Evidence: No screenshots/logs attached. Technician notes indicate cache/cookies cleared and Chrome restarted; RingCentral function restored (see comments by https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209729485132555 on Sep 30 2025).
• Common Issue: Known behavior where excessive browser tabs consume memory, degrading performance of Salesforce + RingCentral integration (system appears unresponsive or fails to disconnect).
• Workaround/Resolution: Clear cache/cookies, close/reopen Chrome, reduce the number of concurrent tabs; confirmed working after steps.
• Business Impact (context): Temporarily degraded calling experience for a sales user; limited to one user and mitigated by simple steps.

Routing Notes
• Category: Incident – Degraded Service
• Systems Affected: RingCentral embedded in Salesforce (Chrome browser resource contention)
• Attachments: None provided (technician notes present)

data.name: [SFDC-2290] Add SAVES ATTEMPT CSR Dropdown Option
data.notes:
Name:
Leslie Onley

Email address:
leslie.onley@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
CUST - Client Success

Has your manager approved this ticket?:
Yes

Describe this issue in five words or less. This is used as guidance for the title.:
CSR Drop down list update 

Use this space to explain what you need.:
We need a new option — “SAVES ATTEMPT” — added to the CSR dropdown "TYPE" list. Currently, accounts in collections that are being worked by finance but not yet canceled are marked as “2nd request,” which is inaccurate. By adding “SAVES ATTEMPT,” finance will be able to differentiate between:

Active cancel requests, and

Accounts still in the process of being saved by CSMs or sales through relationship management.

This distinction is critical to develop the correct process flow: Collections → Saves Attempt → Cancel.

Also this has a direct impact on potential revenue saved and/or Lost 

This is what DONE looks like:
“SAVES ATTEMPT” appears as an option in the CSR "Type" dropdown list.

Finance can select “SAVES ATTEMPT” when noting accounts in collections that are not yet canceled.

Reports can split cancel requests from saves attempts, giving visibility into this process.

Please update in both places that CSR's can be submitted through: Quicklinks and the account page drop down list

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Feature Request

Please fully describe this Feature:
Adding “SAVES ATTEMPT” as a dropdown option provides accurate categorization of accounts in collections. It enhances reporting, ensures Finance/CSM/Sales alignment, and improves our ability to manage customer saves before a final cancel is logged and we have to write off revenue. This directly supports better financial tracking and client retention.

User Story:
As a user, I want a SAVES ATTEMPT dropdown option for CSR "Types", so that I can correctly categorize accounts still in recovery efforts, giving CSMs and Sales visibility to act before final cancellation.

Acceptance Criteria:
CSR Type dropdown includes “SAVES ATTEMPT.” (In both places) 

Users can select this value when logging requests.

Reports can filter and distinguish between cancel vs. saves attempt requests.

Tested to confirm no existing workflows are broken.

Select which element of our ESCAPE philosophy best fits with this ticket.:
S - Simplify

Why does this matter to the business or client?:
This creates a clearer process flow, prevents mislabeling of accounts, supports better financial forecasting, and enhances retention efforts by ensuring CSMs and Sales are looped in before cancellation. By distinguishing between true cancels and active saves, we gain visibility into potential revenue saved vs. revenue lost, which is critical for accurate reporting, forecasting, and retention strategy.

How important is this to your daily work?:
Critical

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
External Customers

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
500+

Additional Context:
Importance: High – directly impacts Finance, CSRs, CSMs, and Sales workflows.

Impact: Affects ~100% of CSR cancel/save requests (dozens weekly).

Revenue Impact: Directly tied to revenue saved or lost, since the “SAVES ATTEMPT” designation allows us to track recovery efforts that can preserve client accounts and prevent churn.

Urgency: Needed to cleanly separate saves from cancels and ensure proper reporting for both retention strategy and financial outcomes. 

———————————————
